titles.title: Small Business Meat Producer and Marketer Protection Act of 1993
To clarify the eligibility of certain small businesses for loans under the Small Business Act, to aid, protect, and preserve small businesses in meat production and marketing, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Livestock.
Referred to the Subcommittee on SBA Legislation and the General Economy.
Executive Comment Requested from USDA, SBA.
Unfavorable Executive Comment Received from SBA.
Unfavorable Executive Comment Received from USDA.

committee.name: House Small Business
committee.subcommittee: SBA Legislation and the General Economy

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Small Business Meat Producer and Marketer Protection Act of 1993 - Amends the Small Business Act to change the loan eligibility requirements for certain small businesses. Defines "meatpacker or meat marketer engaged in commerce." Imposes limits on the slaughter, sale, purchase, and forward delivery of certain livestock by meatpackers or meat marketers engaged in commerce. Establishes fines for violations of this Act.
